title: "LA Education"
execute: 
  echo: false

---


```{r}
Sys.setenv(VROOM_SHOW_PROGRESS = "false")
options(cli.progress_show_after = Inf)
options(tigris_use_cache = TRUE)
options(tigris_progress = FALSE)

library(tidycensus)
library(tidyverse)
library(leaflet)
library(sf)

# Get ACS data
edu_data <- get_acs(
  geography = "tract",
  variables = c(total = "B15003_001", bachelors = "B15003_022"),
  year = 2022,
  survey = "acs5",
  state = "CA",
  county = "Los Angeles",
  geometry = TRUE,
  output = "wide"
)

# Calculate % with bachelor's degree
edu_data <- edu_data |>
  mutate(pct_bachelors = 100 * bachelorsE / totalE)

# Create color palette
pal <- colorNumeric(
  palette = "Blues",
  domain = edu_data$pct_bachelors,
  na.color = "transparent"
)

# Create the map
leaflet(edu_data) |>
  addProviderTiles("CartoDB.Positron") |>
  addPolygons(
    fillColor = ~pal(pct_bachelors),
    weight = 0.5,
    opacity = 1,
    color = "white",
    dashArray = "3",
    fillOpacity = 0.7,
    highlightOptions = highlightOptions(
      weight = 2,
      color = "#666",
      fillOpacity = 0.9,
      bringToFront = TRUE
    ),
    label = ~paste0(
      "Census Tract: ", GEOID, "<br>",
      "Bachelor's Degree: ", round(pct_bachelors, 1), "%"
    ) |> lapply(htmltools::HTML),
    labelOptions = labelOptions(
      style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "3px 8px"),
      textsize = "13px",
      direction = "auto"
    )
  ) |>
  addLegend(
    pal = pal,
    values = ~pct_bachelors,
    opacity = 0.7,
    title = "Bachelor's Degree (%)",
    position = "bottomright"
  ) |>
  # Add title as overlay control
  addControl(
    html = "<div style='text-align:center; font-size:18px; font-weight:bold;'>Bachelor's Degree Rates in Los Angeles County</div>",
    position = "topright"
  ) |>
  # Add subtitle
  addControl(
    html = "<div style='text-align:center; font-size:14px;'>% of Adults Aged 25+ with at Least a Bachelor's Degree (ACS 2022)</div>",
    position = "topright"
  ) |>
  # Add source
  addControl(
    html = "<div style='text-align:center; font-size:11px; color:gray;'>Source: U.S. Census Bureau, ACS 5-Year Estimates</div>",
    position = "bottomleft"
  )
```
This interactive map visualizes the percentage of adults aged 25 and older with at least a bachelor's degree across census tracts in Los Angeles County, based on data from the U.S. Census Bureauâ€™s 2022 American Community Survey (ACS). Each tract is shaded using a blue color scale, where darker shades represent higher educational attainment. Users can hover over individual tracts to see detailed percentages and census tract identifiers. The map provides an engaging way to explore spatial disparities in higher education across the region and can help identify communities with notably high or low levels of bachelor's degree attainment. The visualization integrates ACS data with leaflet mapping to present complex geographic and demographic data in a user-friendly format.
